availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Margaret Ursula Gray Campbell (Ballard County, Kentucky, resident.)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Married to Thomas Dillon Campbell. Mother of James N. Campbell, Mary C. Campbell, Frank Campbell, William L. Campbell, and Leona Campbell. Resident of Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 625.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 43B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 5, p. 442A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 24290.
Ruth and Albert Campell, "Campell-Grey," in Ballard and Carlisle Counties History, Volume I, ed. Ballard-Carlisle Historical-Genealogical Society, (Dallas, TX: Taylor Publishing, 1993), p. 47.
"Margaret Ursula Hickman (1834-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial 128403463, accessed September 16, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/128403463.
